intro: Carduncellus pinnatus subsp. eupinnatus, commonly known as the slender thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, hairy stems and deeply lobed, silvery-gray leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a spherical inflorescence, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the Asteraceae family.
